column4: grrr people in #bash aere asleep ahnyone jhere avilable to help me with a scripting problem?
perhaps.
http://dpaste.com/38211/ this script refuses to repeat the entire sequence
do you get any particular errors?  where does it stop?

http://dpaste.com/38202/ this was the script before one of the people in #bash "fixed it up" for me no i dont get errors it just repeats what i am supposing is the last command determined by the if satement.
i just tried swapping around the commands and it is just repeating the last command determined by the if statement
what types of values does gcbotexplore return
thay are xmacro scripts save copies something off a section of a screen and saves it in gcbotsvtxt explore is mouse moves as is plunder
explore and plunder are just as easily replaced by echo tests
so if I understand quickly, you want it to break out of the inner loop? and do the whole thing over gain?  At the moment, that will never happen,  on what condition do you want it to happen?
always thats why i used a while [ 1 ] statement
i dont want the entire loop broken unless i manually break it
the question is why wont it loop and how do i fix it
I know.  Will do that.  try putting $(  ) around them.
putting $() around what?
oh, sorry about the "I know..." don't know where that came from.  Around the explore and plunder .
$( ) around the commands will their output act like a variable to be stored in the other variables.
i see and how will this change anything?
ok what that does is is break the for loop. it gives errors on line 19 and 21 and then just executes what ever command is after the done >
err done <

otherwise, gcbotstdin and out are storing them as a string.  That is not what you want, right.    I have to go,  sorry I haven't helped.  Either add a break statement to the inner loop, or make sure gcbotexplore eventually returns something false.
